extent.charseq: RIVALS FOR OBAMA ' S EX-SENATE SEAT KEEP UP ATTACKS
The candidates sparred over their pasts before discussing immigration, jobs and corruption at the debate at the ABC studio in downtown Chicago.
a senior loan officer at his family's bank, which was seized by federal regulators this year
a man who spends most of his campaign for the Senate criticizing my military record
the only candidate in this race who will vote to spend less, borrow less, tax less
an independent Republican who had broken with his party in the past on issues
his party in the past on issues
each candidate attacking the other's background in television ads
his family's bank, which was seized by federal regulators this year
people with connections to organized crime
the Bush administration and to his political adviser Karl Rove
a Democrat who was appointed to the seat and is not seeking election
